009package com.weather.sdk; // Intentionally add extra spaces
010
011import com.weather.sdk.exception.WeatherSDKException;
012import com.weather.sdk.model.WeatherData;
013import java.io.Closeable;
014
015/**
016 * The main interface for the Weather SDK that provides weather data retrieval and management
017 * functionality.
018 *
019 * <p>This interface defines the contract for interacting with OpenWeatherAPI through a fluent,
020 * production-ready SDK that supports multiple operation modes, caching, metrics collection, and
021 * graceful resource management.
022 *
023 * <p><strong>Thread Safety:</strong> All implementations of this interface must be thread-safe and
024 * support concurrent access from multiple threads without external synchronization.
025 *
026 * <h2>Core Features</h2>
027 *
028 * <ul>
029 *   <li>Weather data retrieval by city name
030 *   <li>Intelligent caching with configurable TTL and LRU eviction
031 *   <li>Two operation modes: on-demand and polling
032 *   <li>Comprehensive metrics and diagnostics
033 *   <li>Graceful shutdown and resource cleanup
034 *   <li>Support for multiple API keys via registry
035 * </ul>
036 *
037 * <h2>Usage Examples</h2>
038 *
039 * <h3>Basic Usage (On-Demand Mode)</h3>
040 *
041 * <pre>
042 * // Create SDK instance using builder
043 * SDKConfiguration config = new WeatherSDKBuilder()
044 *     .apiKey("your-api-key")
045 *     .mode(SDKMode.ON_DEMAND)
046 *     .build();
047 *
048 * try (WeatherSDK sdk = new DefaultWeatherSDK(config)) {
049 *
050 *   // Fetch weather data
051 *   WeatherData weather = sdk.getWeather("New York");
052 *   System.out.println("Temperature: " + weather.getTemperature().getTemp() + "K");
053 *
054 *   // Check performance metrics
055 *   SDKMetrics metrics = sdk.getMetrics();
056 *   System.out.println("Cache hit ratio: " + metrics.getCacheHitRatio());
057 * }
058 * </pre>
059 *
060 * <h3>Polling Mode</h3>
061 *
062 * <pre>
063 * // Create SDK with automatic polling every 5 minutes
064 * SDKConfiguration config = new WeatherSDKBuilder()
065 *     .apiKey("your-api-key")
066 *     .mode(SDKMode.POLLING)
067 *     .pollingInterval(Duration.ofMinutes(5))
068 *     .build();
069 *
070 * try (WeatherSDK sdk = new DefaultWeatherSDK(config)) {
071 *
072 *   // Weather data is automatically updated in background
073 *   WeatherData weather = sdk.getWeather("London");
074 *   // Data is fresh from the latest polling cycle
075 * }
076 * </pre>
077 *
078 * <h3>Multiple API Keys</h3>
079 *
080 * <pre>
081 * // Register multiple SDK instances for different API keys
082 * WeatherSDK sdk1 = SDKRegistry.createSDKInstance("key1", config1);
083 * WeatherSDK sdk2 = SDKRegistry.createSDKInstance("key2", config2);
084 *
085 * // Later, retrieve by API key
086 * WeatherSDK sdk = SDKRegistry.getSDKInstance("key1");
087 * </pre>
088 *
089 * <h2>Error Handling</h2>
090 *
091 * <p>The SDK uses a comprehensive exception hierarchy to provide clear, actionable error
092 * information:
093 *
094 * <ul>
095 *   <li>{@link com.weather.sdk.exception.ApiKeyException} - Invalid or missing API key
096 *   <li>{@link com.weather.sdk.exception.CityNotFoundException} - City not found in OpenWeatherAPI
097 *   <li>{@link com.weather.sdk.exception.RateLimitException} - API rate limit exceeded
098 *   <li>{@link com.weather.sdk.exception.NetworkException} - Network connectivity issues
099 *   <li>{@link com.weather.sdk.exception.CacheException} - Cache-related errors
100 * </ul>
101 *
102 * <h2>Configuration</h2>
103 *
104 * <p>All configuration is handled through the {@link com.weather.sdk.config.WeatherSDKBuilder}
105 * which provides a fluent API for setting up SDK behavior:
106 *
107 * <ul>
108 *   <li>API key and authentication
109 *   <li>Operation mode (on-demand or polling)
110 *   <li>Polling interval for background updates
111 *   <li>Cache size and TTL configuration
112 *   <li>Network timeout settings
113 * </ul>
114 *
115 * @see com.weather.sdk.config.WeatherSDKBuilder
116 * @see com.weather.sdk.config.SDKConfiguration
117 * @see com.weather.sdk.config.SDKMode
118 * @see com.weather.sdk.model.WeatherData
119 * @see com.weather.sdk.SDKRegistry
120 * @since 1.0.0
121 */
122public interface WeatherSDK extends Closeable {
123
124  /**
125   * Retrieves current weather data for the specified city.
126   *
127   * <p>This method implements intelligent caching logic:
128   *
129   * <ul>
130   *   <li>Checks cache first for fresh data (within TTL)
131   *   <li>Fetches from OpenWeatherAPI if cache miss or stale data
132   *   <li>Automatically caches successful API responses
133   *   <li>Implements retry logic for transient failures
134   * </ul>
135   *
136   * <p><strong>Thread Safety:</strong> This method is safe to call concurrently from multiple
137   * threads.
138   *
139   * @param cityName the name of the city to retrieve weather for. Must not be null or empty.
140   *     Leading/trailing whitespace will be trimmed.
141   * @return the current weather data for the specified city
142   * @throws com.weather.sdk.exception.ApiKeyException if the API key is invalid or missing
143   * @throws com.weather.sdk.exception.CityNotFoundException if the city could not be found
144   * @throws com.weather.sdk.exception.RateLimitException if the API rate limit has been exceeded
145   * @throws com.weather.sdk.exception.NetworkException if a network error occurs during API
146   *     communication
147   * @throws com.weather.sdk.exception.WeatherSDKException for any other weather-related errors
148   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the cityName parameter is null or empty after trimming
149   * @throws InterruptedException if the operation is interrupted during retry attempts
150   *     <h4>Input Validation</h4>
151   *     <ul>
152   *       <li>City name must not be null
153   *       <li>City name must not be empty after trimming whitespace
154   *       <li>City name length should be reasonable (1-100 characters recommended)
155   *     </ul>
156   *     <h5>Retry Behavior</h5>
157   *     <ul>
158   *       <li>Automatically retries on network failures (up to 3 attempts)
159   *       <li>Uses exponential backoff with 500ms base delay
160   *       <li>Does not retry on client errors (4xx responses)
161   *       <li>Logs retry attempts at DEBUG level
162   *     </ul>
163   *     <h5>Caching Behavior</h5>
164   *     <ul>
165   *       <li>Default cache size: 10 cities
166   *       <li>Default TTL: 10 minutes
167   *       <li>LRU eviction when cache is full
168   *       <li>Thread-safe cache operations
169   *     </ul>
170   *
171   * @since 1.0.0
172   */
173  WeatherData getWeather(String cityName) throws WeatherSDKException, InterruptedException;
174
175  /**
176   * Retrieves current SDK performance and usage metrics.
177   *
178   * <p>This method provides insights into SDK performance including:
179   *
180   * <ul>
181   *   <li>Total API requests made
182   *   <li>Cache hit/miss statistics
183   *   <li>API success/failure rates
184   *   <li>Average response times
185   *   <li>Last API call timestamp
186   * </ul>
187   *
188   * <p><strong>Thread Safety:</strong> This method is safe to call concurrently from multiple
189   * threads. The returned metrics object is a snapshot of current values and will not be updated in
190   * real-time.
191   *
192   * @return current SDK metrics and performance statistics. Never returns null.
193   * @since 1.0.0
194   * @see com.weather.sdk.SDKMetrics
195   */
196  SDKMetrics getMetrics();
197
198  /**
199   * Gracefully shuts down the SDK instance and releases all associated resources.
200   *
201   * <p>This method performs proper cleanup:
202   *
203   * <ul>
204   *   <li>Stops any background polling threads
205   *   <li>Closes HTTP client connections
206   *   <li>Clears internal resources
207   *   <li>Interrupts any pending operations
208   * </ul>
209   *
210   * <p><strong>Thread Safety:</strong> This method can be called safely from any thread. After
211   * shutdown, subsequent method calls will throw {@link IllegalStateException}.
212   *
213   * <p><strong>Idempotent:</strong> This method can be called multiple times safely.
214   *
215   * <p><strong>Blocking Behavior:</strong> This method may block briefly to ensure clean shutdown
216   * of background threads.
217   *
218   * <h4>Lifecycle Management</h4>
219   *
220   * <p>For automatic resource management, consider using try-with-resources:
221   *
222   * <pre>
223   * SDKConfiguration config = new WeatherSDKBuilder().apiKey("key").build();
224   *
225   * try (WeatherSDK sdk = new DefaultWeatherSDK(config)) {
226   *   // SDK automatically shutdown when exiting try block
227   *   WeatherData weather = sdk.getWeather("Boston");
228   * }
229   * </pre>
230   *
231   * @since 1.0.0
232   */
233  void shutdown();
234
235  /**
236   * Closes this SDK instance and releases all resources.
237   *
238   * <p>This method delegates to {@link #shutdown()} to ensure consistent resource cleanup. It
239   * enables the use of try-with-resources statement for automatic resource management.
240   *
241   * <p><strong>Thread Safety:</strong> This method is safe to call concurrently from multiple
242   * threads.
243   *
244   * <p><strong>Idempotent:</strong> This method can be called multiple times safely.
245   *
246   * @since 1.0.0
247   */
248  @Override
249  void close();
250}
